snippet: The International Monetary Fund says it was too optimistic about Greece’s debt and the effect of spending cuts.
abstract: Editorial holds International Monetary Fund's admission that it made serious errors during first bailout of Greece does not go nearly far enough in acknowledging damage done to country and broader European economy; contends European regulators are continuing to repeat same stubborn mistakes today, driving troubled economies further and further into debt.
lead_paragraph: The International Monetary Fund says it was too optimistic about Greece’s debt and the effect of spending cuts.

headline.seo: The I.M.F. Admits Mistakes. Will Europe?
headline.main: The I.M.F. Admits Mistakes. Will Europe?
headline.print_headline: The I.M.F. Admits Mistakes. Will Europe?
